pages.text: Running an $(l:engineering/automaton)Automaton$() requires a set of $(item)Modules$() for it to execute.$(br2)This entry showcases the five essential ones you should be aware of. You should also know that every module will take half a second to execute, provided it doesn't get blocked.
This instruction rotates the $(thing)Head$() clockwise 90 degrees.
This instruction rotates the $(thing)Head$() counter-clockwise 90 degrees.
This instruction sets the $(item)Automaton$() to its up state. If the $(item)Automaton$() is already up, it does nothing.
This instruction sets the $(item)Automaton$() to its down state. If the $(item)Automaton$() is already down, it does nothing.
This instruction does nothing. You may use it should you wish to induce a pause.
